entry.title: Revert "SearchPre: [N.1] use refptr to keep StreamingSearchPrefetchURLLoader"
entry.content:
This reverts commit f626b7fd02f281a3ae4c59e5b420ee36f053a4dc.



Reason for revert: likely causes SearchPreloadUnifiedFallbackBrowserTest.PrerenderDiscardedBeforeServingData test failure, example failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ASan%20LSan%20Tests%20(1)/117727/overview



Original change's description:

> SearchPre: [N.1] use refptr to keep StreamingSearchPrefetchURLLoader

> alive during serving.

>

> Now SearchPrefetchURLLoader::RequestHandler can be executed

> asynchronously, so it is unsafe to use unique pointer to manage the

> loader's lifetime anymore, and the previous CR comments mentioned.

>

> This CL turns to using a scoped_refptr, so that the loader would not be

> deleted as long as it is still serving.

> And now the lifecycle is managed by Mojo.

>

> https://docs.google.com/document/d/1szrOWEV0KpV5bPpWcru8PwnKioM4kvCkCylxqhX6m8o/edit#bookmark=id.k2il17hzyry5

>

> Bug: 1400881, 1463000

> Change-Id: Ifbb551c222717b824f164bdd7da52aac27978eb4

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4344832

> Commit-Queue: Lingqi Chi

> Reviewed-by: Hiroki Nakagawa

> Reviewed-by: Hiroshige Hayashizaki

> Reviewed-by: Kouhei Ueno

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1180711}



Bug: 1400881, 1463000

entry.title: [infra] Increase experiment_percentage of Siso CQ builders to 50%
entry.content:
The initial build metrics are worse than the target builders.

This CL increase the experiment_percentage to reduce the # of revisions

since the last build.



The Siso CQ builders disable tests. So it shouldn't increase workloads

on the test pool.

It also would be able to handle more builds since they don't run tests.

entry.title: Refactor PageIconCookiesContentView
entry.content:
This change refactors this class into a base class with two

implementations:



- OldPageInfoCookiesContentView: an old implementation of the UI used

with Chrome Guard.



- PageInfoCookiesContentView: a new design consistent and used with

User Bypass (the new cookie controls UI).



Common functionality remains in the base class, but views code & Views

distinct to one or the other are now in one of the two derived classes.

entry.title: Split browser forms into renderer forms before passing them to PWM.
entry.content:
This CL splits browser forms into renderer forms to match password

manager's notion of a "form" and to allow password manager to match

the Autofill server predictions with form data it has recorded within

its own renderer component.



Although the change is a bug fix, it is wrapped inside a feature to

act as a potential "kill switch".

entry.title: Autofill update prompt, fix edit icon for it and ko langs.
entry.content:
"it" fixed: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3iEYmQUVdnLZZuG.png



The problem was in the table view which was bigger (due to the longer

labels in affected languages) than the fixed popup width.

It's been fixed by setting the fixed width aligned with the table size,

as UpdateAddressProfileView is only a delegate it can control

the popup width via the `set_fixed_width()` method only.

entry.title: Remove cross-thread task in ForceEncodeRowsOnCurrentThread
entry.content:
From the function name, "ForceEncodeRowsOnCurrentThread" sounds like

it can be called from various different threads, but it looks like

it's always called from the context thread. This makes the

PostCrossThreadTask unnecessary, since we're already on the right

thread for invoking CreateBlobAndReturnResult.



Drop the "OnCurrentThread" suffix from the function name, since it's

not really running on any special thread vs. the other suffix-less

functions in this class.



This CL eliminates one use of CrossThreadPersistent. Subsequent

CLs in this chain will eventually eliminate the other uses.

entry.title: AutofillProfile: Only increment use count if 60sec passed.
entry.content:
With AutofillSuggestionsForAutocompleteUnrecognizedFieldsOnMobile,

filling forms fully annotated with ac=unrecognized degenerates to field

by field filling on mobile. To ensure that use counts (used to order

profiles in suggestions) are not skewed by this, this CL adds logic to

increment the use count only if at least 60sec have passed.



This will also be useful when field by field filling is implemented.

entry.title: [Glanceables] Add focus ring to classroom item view
entry.content:
Add a focus ring for each classroom item view. The focus ring has

rounded corners which match the item views corners exactly. To achieve

this, each item view has its rounded corners set individually, where the

first item has a larger corner radius on top corners, and the last item

has a larger corner radius on bottom corners. This is now calculated

for each item view, instead of clipping the whole item list container

with larger rounded corners.

entry.title: Add kSpeculativeServiceWorkerWarmUpOnInsertedIntoDom feature param
entry.content:
This CL adds kSpeculativeServiceWorkerWarmUpOnInsertedIntoDom feature

param to kSpeculativeServiceWorkerWarmUp feature. When

kSpeculativeServiceWorkerWarmUpOnInsertedIntoDom is true, all the links

in the document will be sent to the browser process.



kSpeculativeServiceWorkerWarmUpOnInsertedIntoDom processes the URL

candidates with FIFO order instead of LIFO. This is because we want to

process the URLs from the top of the document. For other warm-up modes

that are triggered by mouse events or link visibility uses LIFO because

the latest events have more chance to be navigated.



This CL also removes query from URL when sending the URL to browser to

reduce the sending URL count.



Bug: 1431792

entry.title: [Passwords] Ignore OTP fields in UsernameFirst/ForgotPassword flows
entry.content:
When users type in text fields, PasswordManager is notified about

potential usernames for Username First or Forgot Password flows.

Fields that are labeled by the developer as OTP fields should be

ignored. This patch adds a check for OPT_related HTML attributes

and for the input length.



The input length is checked on the renderer side, and HTML attribute

info is porpagated to the browser side, to enable overriding it in

case of an error.

entry.title: Delay fio-dlc install until oobe is complete
entry.content:
OOBE calls to update-engine as soon as network is available. The

simultaneous callt to dlcservice is causing update-engine and dlcservice

to deadlock on each other for 25s until dbus times out.



By delaying the install until OOBE is complete, we are less likely to

have any other calls to update-engine running at the same time.



Bug: b/270003192

entry.title: WebNN: Define DirectML Node for reshape MLOperator
entry.content:
This CL implements the CreateOperatorNodeForReshape() method for WebNN

reshape MLOperator. The DirectML API does not have a real Reshape

operator. The WebNN Reshape is implemented by creating a new NodeOutput

for the input Node. The new NodeOutput has the reshaped dimensions and

is used as the output of the WebNN Reshape operator.



Because there is no real Reshape operator in DirectML graph, when the

input and output of the Reshape are exactly the input and output of the

graph, an Identity operator is inserted to copy the input tensor to the

output tensor.



For unit tests, this CL adds cases that checks the build status of

Reshape operator. Will add cases to check the compute results of Reshape

operator later.



Bug: 1273291

Change-Id: I16d99494a590a24f4f310c6ffaded2cb4c810ffc

entry.title: [Profiles] Fire removed-profile when omitting and removing it from list
entry.content:
This CLs fixes a bug that was introduced when setting the profile to

omitted after it's marked for deletion.



When deleting the profile on the Profile Picker, a dialog is open to

confirm the deletion. After confirming it, the dialog was not being

closed because profile-removed was not fired since the profile is now

omitted and removed from the profiles list. So it is now fired when

first removing the profile from the list, after it is turned to omitted.

entry.title: Avoid HashMap of Member in CustomHighlightMarkersNotOverlapping
entry.content:
In case a GC happens while the HashMap is used, any objects referred

to only from the HashMap will be considered unreachable by the GC and

will be reclaimed. This can lead to UAF and memory corruptions.

Using a HeapHashMap instead solves the issue.

entry.title: Avoid Vector of GCed in AllMediaConstraintSets
entry.content:
In case a GC happens while the Vector is used, any objects referred

to only from the Vector will be considered unreachable by the GC and

will be reclaimed. This can lead to UAF and memory corruptions.

Using a HeapVector instead solves the issue.

entry.title: [HTTP Cache] Add support for upcoming partitioning experiment
entry.content:
This CL adds the supporting code needed to conduct another HTTP cache

partitioning scheme experiment. Specifically, this CL:



- Adds a new scheme where triple-keying is still used except for

opaque-origin subframes, where a shared partition (per top-level

site) is used.



- Allows the HTTP cache of the experiment groups to be cleared when

the experiment begins.



- Some minor refactoring - removes the GetFrameSite and GetIsCrossSite

methods in NetworkIsolationKey in favor of a new passkey method

specifically for use when creating the NetworkAnonymizationKey from

a NIK.

entry.title: SearchPre: [N.1] use refptr to keep StreamingSearchPrefetchURLLoader
entry.content:
alive during serving.



Now SearchPrefetchURLLoader::RequestHandler can be executed

asynchronously, so it is unsafe to use unique pointer to manage the

loader's lifetime anymore, and the previous CR comments mentioned.



This CL turns to using a scoped_refptr, so that the loader would not be

deleted as long as it is still serving.

And now the lifecycle is managed by Mojo.



https://docs.google.com/document/d/1szrOWEV0KpV5bPpWcru8PwnKioM4kvCkCylxqhX6m8o/edit#bookmark=id.k2il17hzyry5

entry.title: Bookmarks++: Dont scroll on creation if visible
entry.content:
Following up to the previous scroll offset CL, this prevents scrolling

on bookmark creation if the bookmark is already visible at the current

scroll position. This will, for example, maintain the scroll position

when a bookmark is deleted and the deletion is undone, and when the user

hits the create new folder button.

entry.title: Add a new 'non-local-root' level for RenderDocument
entry.content:
We planned to experiment with subframe RenderDocument in M117 as

almost all of the test failures have been fixed, but currently there

are still two problems: DevTools provisional probe sinks on local

roots, and RenderWidgetHost not being reused causing performance

regressions.



Since both of those problems only happen on navigations on local

roots, this CL adds a new "non-local-root" level for RenderDocument,

where we will only swap RenderFrameHosts on same-site navigations that

happen on non-local-root frames, which won't trigger the problems

mentioned above.



Note that adding this level won't increase the number of tests being

run on CQ. We do parameterize some navigation tests with the

RenderDocument feature, but we only have 2 levels tested:

kCrashedFrame (only same-site navigations from crashed frame will

change RFH) and kAllFrames (all same-site cross-document navigations

will change RFH, except from initial empty documents).



Bug: 936696

entry.title: Check touch selection menu client is valid before doing button actions.
entry.content:
It is possible that the touch selection menu client is destroyed before

the menu is destroyed. This can leave a stray menu floating around, and

trying to remove it by pressing a menu button causes a crash (since it

tries to do client_->ExecuteCommand when client_ is null).



Ideally, we would figure out why the menu is appearing in the wrong spot

and not being destroyed when it should be. Note also that there are some

situations where it seems intentional that the menu is not destroyed

immediately after the client is destroyed (e.g. for the ChromeOS smart

action, which can perform asynchronous work before showing the menu).

Not sure how to best handle this yet.



Will keep investigating, but for now just prevent the crash by checking

the menu client before doing button actions and returning early if the

client is null.



Bug: 1470581

fetching the promise app icon. This is to solve a bug found in the

previous approach where pinning, unpinning then re-pinning an item in

the shelf caused the kPending effect to always be applied to the icon,

even when the promise app had a kInstalling status.

entry.title: Update two stale TODOs in Screen AI library.
entry.content:
1- Keeping separate 'Ready' states for different functionalities of

Screen AI is too granular. The main concern is the library's

download state which is common between all functionalities, and if

there are discrepancies between initializations, that's a bug and

needs follow up.

2- Transition from 'Failed' to 'Ready' state is acceptable, as that can

happen when library download fails in one try, and is done later.

But the reverse transition is not expected. A 'DumpWithoutCrash' is

added to look for such cases and fix them if needed.

entry.content:
Incorporate Reset settings (represented by the reset card element) into

the System Preferences page. The reset card should not be visible for

guest users, and it will only show if powerwashing is enabled. Also,

the old Reset page should not show under the Revamp.

entry.title: glanceables: Better preferred size change detection
entry.content:
Use actual bubble view preferred size to detect whether updating the

list of items shown in a glanceable bubble changed the bubble preferred

size. This fixes an edge case where preferred size changes even if the

list of items shown remains the same - e.g. if the initial list load

results in an empty list (showing the empty state UI may change the

bubble size compared to the initial, loading UI).

entry.title: viz: Fix perfect cadance calculation
entry.content:
Use nanoseconds when measuring the remainder for the perfect cadence

calculations, so we do not unintentionally truncate the vsync values.

Prior to this fix, if vsync_interval was 16.66ms and

begin_frame_interval_ was 50ms, we would get a remainder of 2 instead of

a remainder of 0.02, and thus we would unintentionally not throttle

certain framesinks.



Bug: b/291797476

entry.title: [Extensions UI] Fix count discrepancy for allSites page and dialog
entry.content:
This CL fixes the extensions count discrepancy between the allSites page

and the edit site permissions dialog for the "customize per extension"

option.



It achieves this by:

- only counting enabled extensions in both places

- Changing the GetExtensionGrantedPermissions method to look at

active permissions for policy installed extensions instead of

looking in extensions prefs for granted permissions

- Using GetExtensionGrantedPermissions in the dialog, for consistency

entry.title: [dPWA] Deflake TrackParentWindowDestructionBeforeViewCreation
entry.content:
While investigating the WebAppUninstallDialogViewBrowserTest flake, it

was noticed that UninstallWithNoBrowserWindow was testing the same

exact thing, i.e. destruction of the parent window that triggered the

uninstallation would not cause an UAF.



The old test was also a remnant of the old logic, where setting up the

dialog view component and the dialog triggerer itself were 2 separate

classes, and it was simpler to delete a window in the middle of that

process. Right now, since everything is synchronously triggered, this

use case can no longer happen, and thus the uninstall with no browser

window test can be used to test the same thing.



Bug: 1467782

entry.title: Fix ExtensionLocalizationThrottle::WillProcessResponse
entry.content:
Synchronous call of `delegate_->CancelWithError()` inside

blink::URLLoaderThrottle::WillProcessResponse() in Blink can cause UAF.

To fix this, this CL change ExtensionLocalizationThrottle::

WillProcessResponse() to set `defer` to true, and asynchronously call

`delegate_->CancelWithError()`.

entry.title: Add Component Updater support for Widevine on ChromeOS Ash
entry.content:
This enables ChromeOS Ash to use a component updated Widevine CDM, if

one is available. Like Linux the CDM must be loaded at boot time, so a

new CDM is simply registered and will be loaded next time the device

restarts.



The update is deployed as a disk image, so it needs to be mounted first

in order to access the files. As well, at boot time the disk image must

be mounted, so this depends on an init script running on ChromeOS to

mount the image (if available) at boot time so that Chrome startup can

access the new CDM.



Tested on a ChromeOS device by manually changing the version of the CDM

bundled, and then verifying that a newer version is downloaded and used

next time the device is rebooted.



Bug: b/223462652

Test: see above

Change-Id: I674e9c3760b627ffa142b410d0982b5503ee7ac4

entry.title: [CustomTab] Align status bar and toolbar colors.
entry.content:
The change ensures that the initial Custom Tab color is propagated

over to the StatusBarColorController, allowing both the

CustomTabToolbar and the StatusBar share the same color.



Screenshot: http://screen/8hX2hGJFirF4LcB.png
